APPARENT.Definition: able to be seen or understood

ARMISTICE DAY.Definition: November 11th, when the end of The First World War is celebrated

CAMARADERIE.Definition: a feeling of friendliness towards people that you work or share an experience with

CARD.Definition: (old fashioned) a funny or strange person

CONSENSUS.Definition: a generally accepted opinion or decision among a group of people

CRITICS.Definition: someone who says that they do not approve of someone or something

CROSSES.Definition: the object that marks where soldiers were buried

CRUMPS.Definition: the falling of shells from artillery

CURSING.Definition: using a word or an expression that is not polite and shows that you are very angry

CYNIC.Definition: people who believe that people are only interested in themselves and are not sincere

CYNICAL.Definition: believing that people are only interested in themselves and are not sincere

DUST.Definition: dry dirt in the form of powder that covers surfaces inside a building, or very small dry pieces of earth, sand, or other substances

ECHOES.Definition: to express or think what someone else has said or thought

FLANDERS.Definition: a region in the south-western part of the Low Countries, now divided between Belgium (where it forms the provinces of East and West Flanders), France, and the Netherlands. It was a powerful medieval principality and the scene of prolonged fighting during the First World War

FRONT LINE.Definition: a place where opposing armies face each other in war and where fighting happens

FUTILE.Definition: (of actions) having no effect or achieving nothing

FUTILITY.Definition: (of actions) having no effect or achieving nothing

GENERAL.Definition: military officers of the highest rank

GENERALS.Definition: military officers of the highest rank

GIST.Definition: the most important pieces of information about something, or general information without details

GRUNTED.Definition: (of a pig) to make a low, rough noise

ICONIC.Definition: very famous or popular, especially being considered to represent particular opinions or a particular time

INCOMPETENT.Definition: not having the ability to do something as it should be done

INTANGIBLE.Definition: impossible to touch, to describe exactly, or to give an exact value

KINDLING.Definition: small dry sticks or other materials used to start a fire

LARK.Definition: a small, brown bird that is known for its beautiful singing

LARKS.Definition: a small, brown bird that is known for its beautiful singing

LICE.Definition: a very small insect that lives on the bodies or in the hair of people and animals

LINE.Definition: the line', in the context of World War One, was where the two sides fought against each other

LUMP.Definition: put together in the same category

MACHINE GUN.Definition: an automatic gun that can fire a lot of bullets one after the other very quickly

NERVE GAS.Definition: a poisonous gas, often used as a weapon, that damages the nerves

NICHE.Definition: interesting to, aimed at, or affecting only a small number of people

NO MAN'S LAND.Definition: the land between the two sides in World War One

OPPONENTS.Definition: a person you are competing against

OVER THE TOP.Definition: (of World War One) to be sent towards the enemy

PATRIOTIC.Definition: showing love for your country and being proud of it

POPPIES.Definition: a plant with large, delicate flowers that are typically red and have small, black seeds

QUARREL.Definition: an angry disagreement between two or more people or groups

RIPE OLD AGE.Definition: (used here sarcastically) the condition of being very old; used especially to talk about someone who has a long healthy life

RUM.Definition: a strong alcoholic drink made from the juice of the sugar cane plant

SENTIMENT.Definition: a thought, opinion, or idea based on a feeling about a situation, or a way of thinking about something

SENTIMENTAL.Definition: giving too much importance to emotions, especially love or sadness

SLAUGHTERED.Definition: killed cruelly and unfairly, especially in a war

SLOGGED.Definition: to travel or move with difficulty, for example through wet, sticky soil or snow, or when you are very tired

SMUG.Definition: too pleased or satisfied about something you have achieved or something you know

SNEAK.Definition: to go somewhere secretly, or to take someone or something somewhere secretly

SUPERIORS.Definition: higher in rank or social position than others

SWINE.Definition: a person who you consider to be extremely unpleasant and unkind

TELLING.Definition: showing the truth about a situation or showing what someone really thinks

TRENCHES.Definition: a deep hole dug by soldiers and used as a place from which they can attack the enemy while being hidden

UPBEAT.Definition: full of hope, happiness, and good feelings

WHISTLED.Definition: to make a high sound by forcing air through the lips
